Weird, I never thought about the possibility of JUnit executing the rules in the "wrong" order.
I see there are a few other tests that use multiple rules, perhaps we should change them as well: HotRodListenerWithDslFilter, HotRodCacheQueries, LuceneTransformationTest. Or did you only use a RuleChain here because you needed the constructor parameter, and it wasn't available in the initializer?
